item.title: Making Semi Auto Cast Entangle
item.dc:creator: @S_C_A_R_Bot S C A R Bot
item.description:
@S_C_A_R_Bot wrote:

Its a loop … When entangleDelay is more than 0 it teleports to where its standing … If that doesnt work out you can also try and ignore the incoming walk packets

item.title: Making Semi Auto Cast Entangle
item.dc:creator: @S_C_A_R_Bot S C A R Bot
item.description:
@S_C_A_R_Bot wrote:

public void Entangle(int EntangleDelay) { while(EntangleDelay > 0) { teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; sendmessage("A magical force keeps you from moving!"); } }

dont forget to add

public int EntangleDelay = 0;

simply use

Entangle(20);

You can try it

UPDATED: made loop.

Read full topic

item.title: Making Semi Auto Cast Entangle
item.dc:creator: @Steph2 Steph.
item.description:
@Steph2 wrote:

public void IceBarrage(){ hitDiff = 5 + misc.random(25); // You might not need this inCombat(); attackPlayersWithin(539, 30, 10); actionTimer = 5; setAnimation(1979); teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; } public void IceBurst(){ hitDiff = 5 + misc.random(17); inCombat(); attackPlayersWithin(363, 22, 10); actionTimer = 1; setAnimation(1979); teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; }

I Just Want This To Entangle The Player So They Can’t Move, I Don’t Know Where To Put It.

Read full topic
